thread.title: Magnolia Market is Being Sued By Visitor For Head Injury - Woman Sues Chip and Joanna Gaines
thread.title_full: Magnolia Market is Being Sued By Visitor For Head Injury - Woman Sues Chip and Joanna Gaines

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Magnolia Market is Being Sued By Visitor For Head Injury - Woman Sues Chip and Joanna Gaines
text:
Waco, Texas draws an estimated 25,000 visitors a weekâ€”many of whom are traveling for a chance to visit Magnolia Market at the Silos . But now one of those guests is suing Chip and Joanna Gaines for an injury she claims she experienced on the property.
Magnolia Market is being sued by Nancy Brown, a visitor from San Antonio, who says she sustained head injuries while visiting the Silos back in June, the Waco Tribune-Herald reports. Brown claims that low-hanging steel rods, which support the canopies attached to picnic tables on the premises, caused her injury.

A post shared by Magnolia (@magnolia) on Sep 8, 2016 at 8:04am PDT
According to Brown, she hit her head on the rods while trying to sit down, and claims they were concealed. "[The] Plaintiff suffered serious and permanent injuries as a direct result of the dangerous condition created by the height and steel rods used for the canopies which are affixed to picnic tables located in an outdoor dining area," the lawsuit explains. It's not clear which set of canopies and picnic tables outside the market may have caused the incident.
Our favorite lunch spot these days is right under the black and white canopies at the #MagnoliaSilos! Which food truck at the Silos is your favorite? #MagnoliaSilos #Wacotown #FoodTrucks ðŸ“·: @Kellyhornberger
A post shared by Magnolia (@magnolia) on Nov 1, 2016 at 8:17am PDT
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below This isn't the first time Chip and Joanna Gaines have dealt with legal issues surrounding their Silos property. Last year, the Fixer Upper stars were sued by neighbors of Magnolia Market over the location of a gate that separates the retail destination from their neighbors' property.
From: Country Living
